Articles.Content:
Where did you get your MM dll from ?

Edit : it could be an AntiVirus or Windows security problem. Please comy your KSP install outside of C:\Program Files (x86)\ (like a c\games) and try again.

Edited January 12, 2015 by sarbian

MM DLL is the one pulled by CKAN, version 2.5.8 I believe.

As for the install directory, this is a Steam install, so it kind of goes where it goes. In previous versions I had MM installed with no problems, and mods that use MM (such as KAS) worked flawlessly as well.

If it were a security issue I would think that Windows would expressly be giving me a hard time about it though, no?

MM DLL is the one pulled by CKAN, version 2.5.8 I believe.

As for the install directory, this is a Steam install, so it kind of goes where it goes. In previous versions I had MM installed with no problems, and mods that use MM (such as KAS) worked flawlessly as well.

If it were a security issue I would think that Windows would expressly be giving me a hard time about it though, no?

Steam downloads the installer, you can find it and do multiple installs.

Alternatively, do a clean install and then copy the entire directory.

If it were a security issue I would think that Windows would expressly be giving me a hard time about it though, no?

No. Other had similar issue and it would be a logical explanation for the exception you get.

Steam allow you to choose an alternate path when you install a game. And KSP does not require steam anyway, so you can just copy the game elsewhere to test.

No. Other had similar issue and it would be a logical explanation for the exception you get.

Steam allow you to choose an alternate path when you install a game. And KSP does not require steam anyway, so you can just copy the game elsewhere to test.

Well that didn't help at all. However, the clever guy who suggested I open debug while it was loading (didn't know you could even do that) might have helped.

got this grab when it got stuck.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/hlf5lv9eorkb25e/screenshot.png?dl=0

Yeah, your output_log shows the same thing, but with less pretty colors.

Have you tried an older version of MM?

MM DLL is the one pulled by CKAN, version 2.5.8 I believe.

As for the install directory, this is a Steam install, so it kind of goes where it goes. In previous versions I had MM installed with no problems, and mods that use MM (such as KAS) worked flawlessly as well.

If it were a security issue I would think that Windows would expressly be giving me a hard time about it though, no?

I've just copied the whole Kerbal Space Program folder out of the steam directory to a new location (to disable unwanted steam updates), and it works fine.

It is the same exception. MM can't read its own DLL...

As Kowgan suggested try with an older version and/or install the last one by hand.

Hello to all.

Is there anyway to find out what line or entity of a cfg is causing an error?

I am getting;

[LOG 06:08:06.808] [ModuleManager] ModuleManager: 3078 patches applied, found 1 error

1 error in GameData/TweakScale/CMES_Tweakscale.cfg

but when searching through the ksp.log and output_log.txt, the above is all that is shown that has anything to do with the error...

I am hoping that I can find out where to look for the error.
The log should mention the entry.

The log should mention the entry.

H'mm, ok...

I am re-running and will include both logs... I see where it says 1 error found, but nothing in the logs regarding a bust in a MM load...

thanks for your help and always thanks for all of your mods and work...

EDIT: here is a link to the compressed logs.

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/evxn0uwgq74x8aw/AAAAk4Z0hh_UsXsWEDX6_Zq5a?dl=0

thanks.

Edited January 13, 2015 by drtedastro

It is the same exception. MM can't read its own DLL...

As Kowgan suggested try with an older version and/or install the last one by hand.

Weirdly, I installed it on install #2 using Tinkertime and it loaded no problem. Maybe the problem is how CKAN was installing it... will check more thoroughly this evening.

Honestly, I updated my own MM through CKAN. From 2.5.6 to 2.5.8.

Successfully
dstonecross : if you still have the not working MM dll somewhere could you upload it on dropbox or something like it ? I kinda expect it to be truncated or somehow corrupted but I want to check.

dstonecross : if you still have the not working MM dll somewhere could you upload it on dropbox or something like it ? I kinda expect it to be truncated or somehow corrupted but I want to check.

I think I figured it out.

Don't have the MM .dll file in the general KSP folder as well as in the game data folder, or it freezes. remove the /gamedata one and leave the /ksp one and it works fine.
Although it should be on the GameData folder, not in the main KSP folder. But I'm not sure this will make any difference.
Having dll's in the KSP folder can unpredictable and deleterious effects.
Like making the maintainer mad and unwilling to support bugs.

Hi there, I wonder if anyone could give me a hint on this:

I tried to change the Karbonite converter recipes slightly using the @ operator in the MM patch. Problem is: there are 3 identical regolith modules in there, holding the 3 different recipes (3x MODULE[REGO_ModuleResourceConverter] ).

I now checked my syntax and realized that the @ operator only changes the first match, even if I put three for the three recipes in the patch. Can anyone give me a hint on how to work around this? I would hate to just edit the part config files.

Many thanks

PS: Is there a way to "find-and-replace" a string in the config file using MM?

Hint:

@MODULE,0
{
lol stuff
}

@MODULE[thatmodule],2
{
not-so-lol-stuff
}

@Sarbian: Bad sides of a maintainer. I'm trying my best at my knowledge limits to ease some of your work here in the forums. Let me know if I can help elsehow.

Edited January 14, 2015 by Kowgan
fixing stupidity

I wanna do it, but I'm afraid to double post information there. I also noticed that many of the info I've asked here are already written there, but they were not clear enough to me at the time.

Would it be okay if I made a "MM for du beginners", or "MM FAQ" section over there, covering the most basics/most asked questions over here, even if that means probably repeating already existent info?
Yes, feel free to add a new page. I Can always copy/paste stuff elsewhere if I want to.
Thank you all :-)
